page.title: 12Farming in Sheering.
page.content: Most of the land around Sheering is used for crops.We saw barley,broad beans,wheat and rape growing.There is also grass for hay. However there is a{beef}farm.The farmer here grows wheat and barley.The grain and straw are both used for animal feed.To this he adds minerals,salt and protein,the amount of which depends on the size of the animal. Friesian cattle are kept,because they fatten quickly.The calves come at a week old from another Essex farm and are kept until they are about 14 months old.Then they are locally slaughtered at Hatfield Heath.Most of the meat is high quality and sold to hotels and restaurants.There are also four cats which catch the mice on the farm.
